translated: Abhidharma Collection of Categories Treatise, Scroll 5
Composed by Venerable Vasumitra
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order

Chapter 5, Part 2: Distinguishing Latent Tendencies. As for the ignorance eliminated by seeing cessation, how many latent tendencies increase due to the object but not due to association? How many latent tendencies increase due to association but not due to the object? How many latent tendencies increase both due to the object and due to association? How many latent tendencies do not increase due to the object and do not increase due to association?

Answer:ğŸ”½Those that increase due to the object but not due to association are the ignorance eliminated by seeing cessation that takes contaminated objects and the universal latent tendencies as its objects.

Those that increase due to association but not due to the object are the latent tendencies eliminated by seeing cessation that take pure objects as their objects, excluding the ignorance eliminated by seeing cessation that takes pure objects as its objects.

The phrase â€œthey increase because of the object and because of associationâ€ refers to all the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplation of the mind of the Way and that have as their object the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplation of the mind of the Way.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthey do not increase because of the object and because of associationâ€ refers to the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplation of the mind of the Way and that have as their object the pure influences, and also to the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplations of the mind of suffering and the mind of the cause of suffering and that are not universal, and also to all the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplations of the mind of the path and the mind of cultivation.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œthey increase because of the object and not because of associationâ€ refers to the universal impure influences.

The phrase â€œthey increase because of association and not because of the objectâ€ refers to the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplation of the mind of the Way and that have as their object the pure influences.

The phrase â€œthey increase because of the object and because of associationâ€ refers to the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplation of the mind of the Way and that have as their object the impure influences.

The phrase â€œthey do not increase because of the object and because of associationâ€ refers to the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplations of the minds of suffering and the cause of suffering and that are not universal, and also to all the impure influences that are eliminated by the contemplations of the minds of the path and cultivation.
The co-arisen mental factors and dissociated formations are increased by the object-condition, but not by the associated condition, of the contaminants abandoned by seeing cessation.
The remaining contaminants are not increased by the object-condition or by the associated condition.
The same applies to those abandoned by seeing the path.

As for the greed abandoned by cultivation, how many contaminants increase it by the object-condition but not by the associated condition, how many contaminants increase it by the associated condition but not by the object-condition, how many contaminants increase it both by the object-condition and by the associated condition, and how many contaminants do not increase it either by the object-condition or by the associated condition?
The answer is:

Those that increase it by the object-condition but not by the associated condition are all those abandoned by cultivation and the universal contaminants, excluding the ignorance associated with greed abandoned by cultivation.
Those that increase it by the associated condition but not by the object-condition are none.
Those that increase it both by the object-condition and by the associated condition are the ignorance associated with greed abandoned by cultivation.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with suffering and the aggregates associated with the cause do not increase through the object.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through association,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with cessation and the view of the aggregates associated with the path do not increase through association.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with suffering and the aggregates associated with the cause do not increase through the object.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through association,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with cessation and the view of the aggregates associated with the path do not increase through association.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with suffering and the aggregates associated with the cause do not increase through the object.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through association,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with cessation and the view of the aggregates associated with the path do not increase through association.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with suffering and the aggregates associated with the cause do not increase through the object.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through association,â€ this means that the view of the aggregates associated with cessation and the view of the aggregates associated with the path do not increase through association.
Because they do not increase due to being associated with it, but due to being its object.
Hatred and pride to be eliminated by cultivation are also like this.
As for ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation,

how many proclivities increase due to being its object but not due to being associated with it, how many proclivities increase due to being associated with it but not due to being its object, how many proclivities increase due to being both its object and associated with it, and how many proclivities do not increase due to being its object or associated with it?
The answer is:
Those that increase due to being its object but not due to being associated with it refer to the proclivities to be eliminated by cultivation, ignorance, and the universal proclivities.
Those that increase due to being associated with it but not due to being its object are none.
Those that increase due to being both its object and associated with it refer to all the proclivities to be eliminated by cultivation, except for ignorance to be eliminated by cultivation.

Those that do not increase due to being its object or associated with it refer to the proclivities to be eliminated by seeing suffering and its cause, which are not universal, and all the proclivities to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path.
As for the associated dharmas, those that increase by the object but not by association are the universal contaminants.
Those that increase by association but not by the object do not exist.
Those that increase by the object and also by association are all the contaminants eliminated by cultivation.

Those that do not increase by the object and also not by association are the contaminants eliminated by seeing suffering and its cause that are not universal, and all those eliminated by seeing cessation and the path.

As for the concomitant mental activities and formations dissociated from the mind that arise simultaneously with them, all those eliminated by cultivation and the universal contaminants increase by the object but not by association.
The remaining contaminants do not increase by the object and also not by association.

There are forty-eight ignorances, namely the ignorance associated with wrong views to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, the ignorance associated with doubt to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, the ignorance associated with wrong views and doubt to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, the ignorance not associated with wrong views to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, the ignorance not associated with doubt to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, and the ignorance not associated with wrong views and doubt to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation.
The same applies to those to be eliminated by the path of seeing the truth of the path.
The same applies to those bound to the undetermined realm, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.
In the ignorance associated with wrong views to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, how many latent afflictions increase?
The answer is:

The wrong views to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, the contaminated objects to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, and the universal latent afflictions increase in that. In the associated dharmas, the wrong views to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation and the ignorance associated with them, the contaminated objects to be eliminated by the path of seeing cessation, and the universal latent afflictions increase.

The contaminants that increase in the dissociated formations that arise together with them are the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation and have impure objects, as well as the universal contaminants.
How many contaminants increase in the ignorance associated with doubt that is abandoned by seeing cessation?

The answer is:ğŸ”½The contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation and doubt, and the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation and have impure objects, as well as the universal contaminants.

In the associated dharmas, the doubt that is abandoned by seeing cessation and the ignorance associated with it, if they are abandoned by seeing cessation and have impure objects, or are universal contaminants.
In the dissociated formations that arise together with them, the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation and have impure objects, as well as the universal contaminants.
How many contaminants increase in the ignorance associated with wrong views and doubt that are abandoned by seeing cessation?
The answer is:
The wrong views and doubt that are abandoned by seeing cessation, and the contaminants that are abandoned by seeing cessation and have impure objects, as well as the universal contaminants.

In the associated factors, the wrong views and doubts abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the ignorance associated with them, and the impure objects abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the universal proclivities.
In the mental activities not associated with them, the impure objects abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the universal proclivities.
In the ignorance not associated with the wrong views abandoned by the vision of cessation, how many proclivities increase?
The answer is:ğŸ”½The doubts abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the impure objects abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the universal proclivities.

In the associated factors, excluding the wrong views abandoned by the vision of cessation and the ignorance associated with them, all the others abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the universal proclivities.
In the mental activities not associated with them, the impure objects abandoned by the vision of cessation, and the universal proclivities.
In the ignorance not associated with the doubts abandoned by the vision of cessation, how many proclivities increase?
The answer is:

The wrong views eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and path, and the impure factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and path, as well as the universal contaminants.

In the associated factors, excluding the doubts eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the ignorance associated with them, all the other factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the universal contaminants.
In the dissociated factors that arise simultaneously with them, the impure factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the universal contaminants.
In the ignorance not associated with wrong views and doubts eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation, how many contaminants increase?
The answer is:
The impure factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the universal contaminants.

In the associated factors, excluding the wrong views and doubts eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the ignorance associated with them, all the other factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the universal contaminants.
In the dissociated factors that arise simultaneously with them, the impure factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the universal contaminants.
The same applies to the factors eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of the path.
The same applies to the fetters that are not yet severed, those that are bound to the desire realm, those that are bound to the form realm, and those that are bound to the formless realm.

As for the ignorance associated with wrong views that are to be eliminated by seeing cessation, how many proclivities increase due to the object, but not due to association? How many proclivities increase due to association, but not due to the object? How many proclivities increase both due to the object and due to association? How many proclivities do not increase due to the object, nor due to association?

Answer:ğŸ”½Those that increase due to the object, but not due to association, refer to the proclivities that are eliminated by seeing cessation, those that take contaminated objects, and the universal proclivities.
Those that increase due to association, but not due to the object, refer to the wrong views that are eliminated by seeing cessation.
Those that increase both due to the object and due to association are none.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object but do increase through association,â€ this refers to all the propensities that are eliminated by the path of cultivation and those impure influences eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and its cause that are not universally eliminated.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œbecause they increase through the object but do not increase through association,â€ this refers to the impure influences eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation that have impure objects and are universally eliminated.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they increase through association but not through the object,â€ this refers to the false views and the ignorance associated with them that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation.
As for the phrase â€œbecause they increase through the object and also through association,â€ there is none.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object and do not increase through association,â€ this refers to all the propensities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation and are not eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and its cause and are not universally eliminated, and also all the propensities that are eliminated by the paths of insight into the truths of the path and of cultivation.

The forerunners and subsequent non-conjoined activities of these are the contaminants abandoned by the path of seeing cessation that take pure objects and the universal contaminants. They increase by the object, not by association.
The remaining contaminants do not increase by the object or by association.

In the ignorance associated with doubt abandoned by the path of seeing cessation, how many contaminants increase by the object but not by association, how many contaminants increase by association but not by the object, how many contaminants increase both by the object and by association, and how many contaminants do not increase by the object or by association?
The answer is:
Those that increase by the object but not by association are the contaminants abandoned by the path of seeing cessation that take pure objects and the universal contaminants.
Those that increase by association but not by the object are the doubt abandoned by the path of seeing cessation.
Those that increase both by the object and by association are none.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object but do increase through association,â€ this refers to all the remaining impure views that are eliminated during the path of insight into the truths, with the exception of doubt that is eliminated during the path of insight into the truths. It also refers to the passions that are eliminated during the paths of insight into the truths of suffering and the origination of suffering and that are not universally eliminated, as well as all the passions that are eliminated during the path of cultivation.ğŸ”½As for the phrase â€œbecause they increase through the object but do not increase through association,â€ this refers to the passions that are eliminated during the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the path and that have impure objects as well as the universally eliminated passions.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they increase through association but do not increase through the object,â€ this refers to doubt and the ignorance associated with it that are eliminated during the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the path.
As for the phrase â€œbecause they increase through the object and also increase through association,â€ there is none.

As for the phrase â€œbecause they do not increase through the object but do increase through association,â€ this refers to all the remaining impure views that are eliminated during the path of insight into the truths, with the exception of doubt and the ignorance associated with it that are eliminated during the path of insight into the truths. It also refers to the passions that are eliminated during the paths of insight into the truths of suffering and the origination of suffering and that are not universally eliminated, as well as all the passions that are eliminated during the path of cultivation.

The forerunners and subsequent non-conjoined activities of these are the contaminants abandoned by the path of seeing cessation that take pure objects and the universal contaminants. They increase by the object, not by association.
The remaining contaminants do not increase by the object or by association.

In the ignorance associated with wrong views and doubts that are abandoned by the path of seeing cessation, how many contaminants increase by the object but not by association, how many contaminants increase by association but not by the object, how many contaminants increase both by the object and by association, and how many contaminants do not increase by the object or by association?
The answer is:ğŸ”½Those that increase by the object but not by association are the contaminants abandoned by the path of seeing cessation that take pure objects and the universal contaminants.
Those that increase by association but not by the object are the wrong views and doubts abandoned by the path of seeing cessation.
Those that increase both by the object and by association are none.

As for â€œnot increasing through the object but not through association,â€ this refers to all the remaining impurities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and the origination of suffering, and all the impurities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of the path and by the path of cultivation, with the exception of wrong views and doubt that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation.

As for â€œincreasing through association but not through the object,â€ this refers to the impurities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation and that have impure objects and that are universal.

As for â€œincreasing through the object and also through association,â€ this refers to ignorance associated with wrong views and doubt that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation.

As for â€œnot increasing through the object but not through association,â€ this refers to all the remaining impurities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation and that have pure objects, and to those impurities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and the origination of suffering and that are not universal, and all the impurities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of the path and by the path of cultivation, with the exception of ignorance associated with wrong views and doubt that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation.

The defiled factors arisen together with them, and the dissociated factors, are increased by the contaminants to be eliminated by the vision of cessation, which take them as their objects, but not by the associated ones.
The remaining contaminants do not increase them either by taking them as their objects or by being associated with them.

In the ignorance not associated with wrong views to be eliminated by the vision of cessation, how many contaminants increase it by taking it as their object but not by being associated with it? How many contaminants increase it by being associated with it but not by taking it as their object? How many contaminants increase it both by taking it as their object and by being associated with it? How many contaminants do not increase it either by taking it as their object or by being associated with it?

The answer is:ğŸ”½Those that increase it by taking it as their object but not by being associated with it are the ignorance to be eliminated by the vision of cessation that takes defiled factors as its object, and the universal contaminants.
Those that increase it by being associated with it but not by taking it as their object are the doubts to be eliminated by the vision of cessation.
The phrase â€œbecause of the object and because of associationâ€ means all the propensities that are eliminated by the path of cultivation and that have impure objects.

The phrase â€œbecause of neither the object nor because of associationâ€ means all the propensities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and the origination of suffering and that are not universally eliminated, and all the propensities that are eliminated by the paths of insight into the truths of cessation and the path and by the path of cultivation.

The phrase â€œbecause of the object and because of associationâ€ means the universally eliminated propensities.ğŸ”½The phrase â€œbecause of association and not because of the objectâ€ means all the propensities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation and that have pure objects, with the exception of wrong views and ignorance associated with it.
The phrase â€œbecause of the object and because of associationâ€ means all the propensities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truth of cessation and that have impure objects.

Those that increase through the object but not through association are the wrong views and the ignorance associated with them that are eliminated by the path of seeing of cessation, and all the proclivities eliminated by the paths of seeing of suffering and accumulation that are not pervasive, and those eliminated by the paths of seeing of the path and cultivation.

In the mental activities and formations not associated with the mind that arise simultaneously with them, the proclivities eliminated by the path of seeing of cessation that have objects and are pervasive increase through the object but not through association.
The remaining proclivities do not increase through the object or through association in regard to them.

In the ignorance not associated with doubt that is eliminated by the path of seeing of cessation, how many proclivities increase through the object but not through association, how many proclivities increase through association but not through the object, how many proclivities increase both through the object and through association, and how many proclivities do not increase through the object or through association?
The answer is:
Those that increase through the object but not through association are the ignorance that has objects and is eliminated by the path of seeing of cessation, and the pervasive proclivities.
Because they are associated, they increase, but not because they are objects: this refers to wrong views that are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation.

Because they are objects and because they are associated, they increase: this refers to all the remaining impure influences that are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation and have impure objects as their objects, except for ignorance that has cessation as its object.

Neither because they are objects nor because they are associated, they increase: this refers to all the remaining impure influences that are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation and have pure objects as their objects, except for wrong views that have cessation as their object, and those that are eliminated by the paths of seeing suffering and seeing origination and are not pervasive, and those that are eliminated by the paths of seeing the path and cultivation.
In the dharmas that are associated with them, they increase because they are objects, but not because they are associated: this refers to the pervasive impure influences.

Because they are associated, they increase, but not because they are objects: this refers to all the remaining impure influences that are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation and have pure objects as their objects, except for doubt and ignorance associated with them that have cessation as their object.

Because they are objects and because they are associated, they increase: this refers to the impure influences that are eliminated by the path of seeing cessation and have impure objects as their objects.

Those that increase through the object but not through association are the doubt and the ignorance associated with it that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the path, and all the proclivities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of suffering and the origin of suffering and by the path of cultivation, if they are not generally permeating.

The proclivities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation and the path, and the impure objects and generally permeating proclivities that are associated with the thought and thought concomitants that are produced by them, increase through the object but not through association.
The remaining proclivities do not increase through the object and do not increase through association.

With regard to the ignorance that is not associated with false views and doubt that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation, how many proclivities increase through the object but not through association, how many proclivities increase through association but not through the object, how many proclivities increase both through the object and through association, and how many proclivities do not increase through the object and do not increase through association?
The answer is:

Those that increase through the object but not through association are the impure objects and generally permeating proclivities that are eliminated by the path of insight into the truths of cessation.
Because they are associated, they increase, but not because they are objects: none.

Because they are objects, they increase, and also because they are associated: all the remaining contaminants to be eliminated by the path of seeing that take impure objects as their objects, except for ignorance that takes the cessation of the path of seeing as its object.

Neither because they are objects, they increase, nor because they are associated: the contaminants to be eliminated by the path of seeing that take pure objects as their objects, the contaminants to be eliminated by the path of seeing that are not pervasive, and all the contaminants to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.
With regard to the associated dharmas, because they are objects, they increase, but not because they are associated: the pervasive contaminants.

Because they are associated, they increase, but not because they are objects: all the remaining contaminants to be eliminated by the path of seeing that take pure objects as their objects, except for wrong views, doubts, and the ignorance associated with them that take the cessation of the path of seeing as their objects.
Because they are objects, they increase, and also because they are associated: the contaminants to be eliminated by the path of seeing that take impure objects as their objects.

As for the phrase because they do not take it as their object, they do not increase through association, this refers to wrong views, doubts, and the ignorance associated with them that are eliminated by the path of cultivation, as well as all the proclivities eliminated by the path of cultivation.

The formations that are not associated with the mind that arise simultaneously with them are the proclivities eliminated by the path of cultivation that take pure dharmas as their objects, and the pervasive proclivities. They increase in the form of objects, but not in the form of association.
The remaining proclivities do not increase in regard to them either through taking them as objects or through association.
The same applies to the proclivities eliminated by the path of insight into the truths.
The same applies to the proclivities that are not bound to any realm, those bound to the desire realm, those bound to the form realm, and those bound to the formless realm.
Do the proclivities that take impure dharmas as their objects increase in the form of objects and association?
Answer:
If the proclivities increase in the form of objects and association, then those proclivities take impure dharmas as their objects.

There are contaminants that are associated with the object but not with the associated [mind], and therefore increase [in the object]. For example, the contaminants that are universal and take a different realm or stage as their object.
What are they?

The contaminants that are bound to the desire realm and take the form realm as their object, the contaminants that are bound to the desire realm and take the formless realm as their object, the contaminants that are bound to the form realm and take the formless realm as their object, and the contaminants that are bound to the desire realm and take both the form and formless realms as their object.
The same applies to those that take different realms and stages as their objects.
Do all contaminants that take the uncontaminated as their object increase through association with those contaminants?
Answer: If a contaminant takes the uncontaminated as its object, then that contaminant increases through association with it.

There are contaminants that increase through association but not through taking the uncontaminated as their object. For example, the contaminants that are universal and take a different realm or stage as their object.
What are they?

Namely, the latent afflictions that are bound to the desire realm and take the form realm as their object, the latent afflictions that are bound to the desire realm and take the formless realm as their object, the latent afflictions that are bound to the form realm and take the formless realm as their object, and the latent afflictions that are bound to the desire realm and take both the form and formless realms as their object.
The same applies to the objects of different realms.
The objects of cognition, the objects of penetration, the objects of attention, and the dominant objects.
Formless dharmas, visible dharmas, invisible dharmas, resistant dharmas,
non-resistant dharmas, contaminated dharmas, uncontaminated dharmas, conditioned dharmas, unconditioned dharmas,
dharmas with conflict, dharmas without conflict, worldly dharmas, supramundane dharmas, dharmas that fall into the realms,
dharmas that do not fall into the realms, dharmas with taste, dharmas without taste, dharmas that are the basis for indulgence,
dharmas that are the basis for renunciation, mental dharmas, non-mental dharmas, mental factors, non-mental factors,

dharmas, dharmas associated with mind, dharmas not associated with mind, dharmas coexisting with mind, dharmas not coexisting with mind, dharmas that accompany mind, dharmas that do not accompany mind, dharmas with mind as their cause,
dharmas without mind as their cause, dharmas with mind as their similar and immediately antecedent condition, dharmas without mind as their similar and immediately antecedent condition,
dharmas with mind as their object, dharmas without mind as their object, dharmas with mind as their dominant condition,
dharmas without mind as their dominant condition, dharmas that are the result of mind, dharmas that are not the result of mind, dharmas that are the ripening of mind,

dharmas that are not the ripening of mind, dharmas that are action, dharmas that are not action, dharmas associated with action,ğŸ”½dharmas not associated with action, dharmas coexisting with action, dharmas not coexisting with action, dharmas that follow action,ğŸ”½dharmas that do not follow action, dharmas with action as their cause, dharmas without action as their cause, dharmas with action as their similar and immediately antecedent condition, dharmas without action as their similar and immediately antecedent condition, dharmas with action as their object, dharmas without action as their object,

dharmas with action as their dominant condition, dharmas without action as their dominant condition, dharmas that are the result of action, dharmas that are not the result of action, dharmas that are the ripening of action,ğŸ”½dharmas that are not the ripening of action, dharmas that are the cause of action, dharmas that are not the cause of action, dharmas that are the similar and immediately antecedent condition of action, dharmas that are not the similar and immediately antecedent condition of action, dharmas that are the object of action, dharmas that are not the object of action,ğŸ”½dharmas that are the dominant condition of action, dharmas that are not the dominant condition of action, dharmas that are the result of action, dharmas that are not the result of action, dharmas that are the ripening of action,ğŸ”½dharmas that are not the ripening of action, dharmas
karma as object, karma as dominant, non-karma as dominant,
karma as fruit, non-karma as fruit, karma as retribution, non-karma as retribution,
existence, non-existence, associated existence, non-associated existence, co-existent
existence, non-co-existent existence, following existence, non-following existence,

existence as cause, non-existence as cause, conditioned existence as equal and immediate, non-conditioned existence as equal and immediate, conditioned existence as object, non-conditioned existence as object,
conditioned existence as dominant, non-conditioned existence as dominant, existence as fruit, non-existence as fruit,
existence as retribution, non-existence as retribution, pervasion, non-pervasion,
abandonment, non-abandonment, cultivation, non-cultivation,
dharmas that should be cultivated, dharmas that should be realized and dharmas that should not be realized, dharmas that should be practiced,
dharmas that should not be practiced, dharmas with faults, dharmas without faults, black dharmas, white dharmas,

dharmas with hindrances, dharmas without hindrances, dharmas that lead to regression, dharmas that do not lead to regression, dharmas with indications,ğŸ”½dharmas without indications, dharmas that have already arisen, dharmas that have not yet arisen, dharmas that are presently arising, dharmas that are not presently arising,

translated: dharmas that have already ceased, dharmas that have not yet ceased, dharmas that are presently ceasing, dharmas that are not presently ceasing,ğŸ”½dharmas that are dependently arisen, dharmas that are not dependently arisen, dharmas that arise from conditions, dharmas that do not arise from conditions,ğŸ”½dharmas that are causes, dharmas that are not causes, dharmas that have causes, dharmas that do not have causes, dharmas that have already arisen from causes, dharmas that have not yet arisen from causes,
dharmas that are associated with causes, dharmas that are not associated with causes, dharmas that are knots,
dharmas that are not knots, dharmas that are conducive to knots, dharmas that are not conducive to knots, dharmas that are grasped, dharmas that are not grasped,
Dharmas are either dharmas with appropriation or dharmas without appropriation, dharmas that conform to grasping or dharmas that do not conform to grasping,
defiled dharmas or undefiled dharmas, defiled dharmas or non-defiled dharmas,ğŸ”½entangled dharmas or non-entangled dharmas, dharmas that are entangled or dharmas that are not entangled,

translated: dharmas that are to be learned, dharmas that are beyond learning, and dharmas that are neither to be learned nor beyond learning.ğŸ”½dharmas that are to be eliminated by seeing, dharmas that are to be eliminated by cultivation, and dharmas that are not to be eliminated.

There are three realms, namely the realm of desire, the realm of anger, and the realm of harm.
There are also three realms, namely the realm of renunciation, the realm of non-anger, and the realm of non-harm.
There are also three realms, namely the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.
There are also three realms, namely the form realm, the formless realm, and the realm of cessation.
There are three existences, namely desire existence, form existence, and formless existence.
There are three taints, namely the taint of desire, the taint of existence, and the taint of ignorance.
There are three times, namely the past time, the future time, and the present time.
There are three bases for verbal action, namely verbal action based on the past, verbal action based on the future, and verbal action based on the present.
There are three kinds of suffering, namely the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of conditioned existence.
There are three dharmas, namely, dharmas with initial and sustained thought, dharmas without initial thought but only sustained thought, and dharmas without initial and sustained thought.
There are three stages, namely, the stage with initial and sustained thought, the stage without initial thought but only sustained thought, and the stage without initial and sustained thought.
There are three kinds of karma, namely, bodily karma, verbal karma, and mental karma.
There are also three kinds of karma, namely, wholesome karma, unwholesome karma, and indeterminate karma.
There are also three kinds of karma, namely, karma of the learner, karma of the post-learner, and karma of neither the learner nor the post-learner.
There are also three kinds of karma, namely, karma to be eliminated by seeing the truths, karma to be eliminated by cultivation, and karma not to be eliminated.
There are also three kinds of karma, namely, karma to be experienced in the present life, karma to be experienced in the next life, and karma to be experienced in subsequent lives.
There are also three kinds of karma, namely, karma to be experienced as pleasant, karma to be experienced as painful, and karma to be experienced as neither painful nor pleasant.
There are four establishments of mindfulness, namely, mindfulness of the body, mindfulness of feelings, mindfulness of mind, and mindfulness of dharmas.

There are four right efforts, namely, the right effort to abandon evil and unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen, the right effort to prevent evil and unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen from arising, the right effort to give rise to wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the right effort to make wholesome dharmas that have already arisen abide for a long time, not be forgotten, and be cultivated and perfected, and to increase and expand them.

There are four bases of supernatural power, namely, the base of supernatural power accomplished through the practice of concentration by means of desire, the base of supernatural power accomplished through the practice of concentration by means of zeal, the base of supernatural power accomplished through the practice of concentration by means of mind, and the base of supernatural power accomplished through the practice of concentration by means of investigation.
There are four meditations, namely, the first meditation, the second meditation, the third meditation, and the fourth meditation.
There are four noble truths, namely, the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the accumulation of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path.
There are four immeasurables, namely the immeasurable of friendliness, the immeasurable of compassion, the immeasurable of joy, and the immeasurable of equanimity.
There are four formless [absorptions], namely the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

There are four noble lineages, namely the noble lineage of being content with whatever robe one obtains, the noble lineage of being content with whatever alms-food one obtains, the noble lineage of being content with whatever bedding and seats one obtains, and the noble lineage of delighting in abandoning and delighting in cultivating.
There are four fruits of the Å›ramaá¹‡a, namely the fruit of the stream-enterer, the fruit of the once-returner, the fruit of the non-returner, and the fruit of the arhat.
There are four knowledges, namely the knowledge of dharmas, inferential knowledge, knowledge of others' minds, and conventional knowledge.
There are also four knowledges, namely the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the origin [of suffering], the knowledge of cessation [of suffering], and the knowledge of the path [to cessation].

There are four unobstructed abilities, namely the unobstructed ability regarding dharmas, the unobstructed ability regarding meanings, the unobstructed ability regarding expressions, and the unobstructed ability regarding eloquence.
There are four conditions, namely causal condition, immediately preceding condition, object condition, and dominant condition.
There are four nutriments, namely coarse and fine solid food, contact, intention, and consciousness.
There are four floods, namely the flood of desire, the flood of existence, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance.
There are four yokes, namely the yoke of desire, the yoke of existence, the yoke of views, and the yoke of ignorance.
There are four clingings, namely clinging to desire, clinging to views, clinging to precepts and observances, and clinging to a doctrine of self.
There are four dharmas, namely past dharmas, future dharmas, present dharmas, and dharmas that are neither past, future, nor present.
There are also four dharmas, namely dharmas bound to the desire realm, dharmas bound to the form realm, dharmas bound to the formless realm, and unbound dharmas.

translated: There are also four dharmas, namely, dharmas with good causes, dharmas with bad causes, dharmas with indeterminate causes, and dharmas that are neither with good causes nor with bad causes nor with indeterminate causes.

There are also four dharmas, namely, dharmas with an object that is an object, dharmas with an object that is not an object, dharmas with an object that is both an object and not an object, and dharmas with an object that is neither an object nor not an object.
There are five aggregates, namely, the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

There are five appropriated aggregates, namely, the appropriated form aggregate, the appropriated feeling aggregate, the appropriated perception aggregate, the appropriated formation aggregate, and the appropriated consciousness aggregate.
There are five destinies, namely, the destiny of the hells, the destiny of animals, the destiny of hungry ghosts, the destiny of humans, and the destiny of gods.

There are five categories of afflictions, namely, the category of afflictions to be eliminated by seeing suffering, the category of afflictions to be eliminated by seeing the arising [of suffering], the category of afflictions to be eliminated by seeing the cessation [of suffering], the category of afflictions to be eliminated by seeing the path [to the cessation of suffering], and the category of afflictions to be eliminated by cultivation [of the path].
There are five dharmas, namely form dharmas, mind dharmas, mental factors, dharmas not directly associated with the mind, and unconditioned dharmas.
There are six elements, namely the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element.

There are six dharmas, namely dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the origin [of suffering], dharmas to be eliminated by seeing cessation [of suffering], dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the path [to cessation of suffering], dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, and dharmas not to be eliminated.

translated: There are seven latent afflictions, namely latent desire, latent anger, latent attachment to existence, latent pride, latent ignorance, latent views, and latent doubts.
There are seven abodes of consciousness, namely sentient beings with form, with different bodies and different ideations, like humans and some gods, this is the first abode of consciousness.
Sentient beings with form, with different bodies but the same ideation, like the BrahmakÄyika gods at the beginning of the eon, this is the second abode of consciousness.
Sentient beings with form, with a single body and multiple perceptions, like the gods of the Ä€bhÄsvara Heaven, is the third abode of consciousness.
Sentient beings with form, with a single body and a single perception, like the gods of the Åšubhaká¹›tsna Heaven, is the fourth abode of consciousness.

Formless sentient beings, transcending all perceptions of form, eliminating perceptions of obstruction, not thinking of various perceptions, entering the sphere of infinite space, abiding in fullness like the gods of the Ä€kÄÅ›ÄnantyÄyatana Heaven, is the fifth abode of consciousness.ğŸ”½Formless sentient beings, transcending the entire sphere of infinite space, entering the sphere of infinite consciousness, abiding in fullness like the gods of the VijÃ±ÄnÄnantyÄyatana Heaven, is the sixth abode of consciousness.

Formless sentient beings, transcending the entire sphere of infinite consciousness, entering the sphere of nothingness, abiding in fullness like the gods of the Ä€kiÃ±canyÄyatana Heaven, is the seventh abode of consciousness.

There are seven factors of enlightenment, namely the factor of enlightenment of mindfulness, the factor of enlightenment of investigating phenomena, the factor of enlightenment of energy, the factor of enlightenment of joy, the factor of enlightenment of tranquility, the factor of enlightenment of concentration, and the factor of enlightenment of equanimity.
There are eight liberations, namely the first liberation is to have form and contemplate various forms.
The second liberation is to have no internal form but to contemplate external forms.
The third liberation is to attain the liberation of purity and abide in it.
The fourth liberation is to transcend all notions of form, eliminate notions of resistance, and not think of various notions, entering the sphere of infinite space and abiding in it.
The fifth liberation is to transcend the sphere of infinite space, enter the sphere of infinite consciousness, and abide in it.
The sixth liberation is to transcend the sphere of infinite consciousness, enter the sphere of nothingness, and abide in it.
Transcending the sphere of nothingness, one enters the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and abides in it, this is the seventh liberation.
Transcending the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, one enters the cessation of perception and feeling and abides in it, this is the eighth liberation.

There are eight spheres of mastery, namely: having the notion of internal form, one sees few external forms, whether beautiful or ugly, and with regard to those forms one has mastery in knowing and seeing, possessing this notion is the first sphere of mastery.

Having the notion of internal form, one sees many external forms, whether beautiful or ugly, and with regard to those forms one has mastery in knowing and seeing, possessing this notion is the second sphere of mastery.

Without the notion of internal form, one sees few external forms, whether beautiful or ugly, and with regard to those forms one has mastery in knowing and seeing, possessing this notion is the third sphere of mastery.

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms as many, whether beautiful or ugly, one has superior knowledge and superior vision regarding those forms, possessing such perceptions, this is the fourth sphere of mastery.

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms, if blue, blue in color, blue in appearance, blue in luster, like a blue lotus flower, or like fine Benares muslin cloth dyed blue, if blue, blue in color, blue in appearance, blue in luster,

observing external forms in the same way, if blue, blue in color, blue in appearance, blue in luster, one has superior knowledge and superior vision regarding those forms, possessing such perceptions, this is the fifth sphere of mastery.

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms, if yellow, yellow in color, yellow in appearance, yellow in luster, like a kanikara flower, or like fine Benares muslin cloth dyed yellow, if yellow, yellow in color, yellow in appearance, yellow in luster,

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms as yellow, of yellow appearance, yellow color, and yellow luster, it is the same as this. Excellently knowing and excellently seeing those forms, possessing such perceptions is the sixth sphere of mastery.

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms as red, of red appearance, red color, and red luster, just like the bandhujÄ«vaka flower, or like a robe from VÄrÄá¹‡asÄ« dyed with a deep red dye, if red, of red appearance, red color, and red luster.

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms as red, of red appearance, red color, and red luster, it is the same as this. Excellently knowing and excellently seeing those forms, possessing such perceptions is the seventh sphere of mastery.

Internally without form-related perceptions, observing external forms as white, of white appearance, white color, and white luster, just like the star ArundhatÄ«, or like a robe from VÄrÄá¹‡asÄ« of the whitest cloth, if white, of white appearance, white color, and white luster.

Internally without form perception, observing external forms, whether white, white in color, white in appearance, white in luster, also like this, with superior knowledge and superior seeing of those forms, possessing this thought is the eighth sphere of mastery.
